TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ColumnHeader extends System.ComponentModel.Component implements class System.ICloneable
Public Class ColumnHeader Inherits Component Implements ICloneable
public ref class ColumnHeader : System::ComponentModel::Component, ICloneable
type ColumnHeader = class inherit Component interface ICloneable

Docs.summary: Displays a single column header in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A column header is an item in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control that contains heading text. <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> objects can be added to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection> class. To add a group of columns to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection> class. You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Index%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> class to determine where the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is located in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> provides the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Text%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.TextAlign%2A> properties to set the text displayed in the control and the alignment of the text in the column header. To determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is associated with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control, you can reference the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ListView%2A> property. If you want to copy a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> for use in another <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Clone%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates initializing a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control. The example creates <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> objects and sets the column header's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Text%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.TextAlign%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Width%2A> properties. The example also adds items and subitems to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>. To run this example paste the following code in a form and call the `PopulateListView` method from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event handler.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.ListViewAndPictureBox#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListViewAndPictureBox/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.ListViewAndPictureBox#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListViewAndPictureBox/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.ListViewAndPictureBox#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListViewAndPictureBox/VB/form1.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Resizes the width of the column as indicated by the resize style.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.AutoResize%2A> method is only effective once the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> and containing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> have been constructed, and the column is populated with items. If new items are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>, the column will not resize unless <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.AutoResize%2A> is called again.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> in an unusable state. After calling <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> so the memory it was occupying can be reclaimed by garbage collection.
> [!NOTE] > Always call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>. Otherwise, the resources the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is using will not be freed until garbage collection calls the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> object's destructor.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int ImageIndex { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.ImageIndex : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the index of the image displayed in the .
Docs.value: The index of the image displayed in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex%2A> property refers to the index of an image specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SmallImageList%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> that contains the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex%2A> property returns -1 if there is no <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SmallImageList%2A> set on the containing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>. The image displayed in a column is typically used to indicate the state of items in the column.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageKey%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex%2A> are mutually exclusive, meaning if one is set, the other is set to an invalid value and ignored.
The image associated with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is typically used to indicate the state information. If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex%2A> to a value greater than the index of the last item in the associated image list, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex%2A> will be set to the index of the last item in the image list.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ImageKey { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ImageKey : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the key of the image displayed in the column.
Docs.value: The key of the image displayed in the column.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageKey%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageIndex%2A> properties are mutually exclusive, meaning if one is set, the other is set to an invalid value and ignored.
If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.ImageKey%2A> is set to an invalid value, an image will not be displayed, and an exception will not be thrown.
The image associated with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is typically used to indicate the state information.

Docs.summary: Gets the location with the control's of this column.
Docs.value: The zero-based index of the column header within the of the control it is contained in.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of this property does not necessarily correspond to the current visual position of the column header within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>. This can be due to the user reordering the column headers at run time (when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AllowColumnReorder%2A> property is set to `true`). If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is not contained within a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control this property returns a value of -1.

member this.TextAlign : System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the text displayed in the .
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this property to provide different text alignment settings for the text displayed in each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>.
> [!NOTE] > Due to a limitation in the underlying control, this property has no effect on the first column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control, which is always aligned to the left. To work around this limitation in [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)], you can handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.DrawColumnHeader?displayProperty=nameWithType> event and paint the column header yourself.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates initializing a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control. The example also adds items and subitems to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>. To run this example paste the following code in a form and call the `PopulateListView` method from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event handler.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Width { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.Width : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the width of the column.
Docs.value: The width of the column, in pixels.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property enables you to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Width%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> can be set to adjust at run time to the column contents or heading. To adjust the width of the longest item in the column, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Width%2A> property to -1. To autosize to the width of the column heading, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Width%2A> property to -2.
> [!NOTE] > Unexpected behavior can result when the combined width of all columns exceeds 32,768 pixels.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates initializing a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control. The example creates <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> objects and sets the column header's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Text%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.TextAlign%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Width%2A> properties. The example also adds items and subitems to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>. To run this example paste the following code in a form and call the `PopulateListView` method from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event handler.
